verses.kjv: Now it came to pass in the days of Ahasuerus, (this is Ahasuerus which reigned, from India even unto Ethiopia, over an hundred and seven and twenty provinces:)
verses.ct: During the reign of Ahasuerus — the Ahasuerus who ruled over 127 provinces stretching from India to Ethiopia —

verses.kjv: That in those days, when the king Ahasuerus sat on the throne of his kingdom, which was in Shushan the palace,
verses.ct: at that time, when King Ahasuerus was ruling from his royal throne in the fortress city of Shushan,

verses.kjv: In the third year of his reign, he made a feast unto all his princes and his servants; the power of Persia and Media, the nobles and princes of the provinces, being before him:
verses.ct: in the 3rd year of his reign, he hosted a banquet for all his officials and advisors. The military leaders of Persia and Media, along with the nobles and governors of the provinces, were all in attendance.

verses.kjv: When he shewed the riches of his glorious kingdom and the honour of his excellent majesty many days, even an hundred and fourscore days.
verses.ct: He put the vast wealth of his glorious kingdom and the splendor of his greatness on display for many days — 180 days in all.

verses.kjv: And when these days were expired, the king made a feast unto all the people that were present in Shushan the palace, both unto great and small, seven days, in the court of the garden of the king’s palace;
verses.ct: When that period ended, the king held another banquet lasting 7 days for everyone in the fortress of Shushan, from the most important to the least. It took place in the courtyard garden of the royal palace.

verses.kjv: Where were white, green, and blue, hangings, fastened with cords of fine linen and purple to silver rings and pillars of marble: the beds were of gold and silver, upon a pavement of red, and blue, and white, and black, marble.
verses.ct: The courtyard was decorated with white, green, and blue fabric hangings, tied with fine linen and purple cords to silver rings on marble columns. Gold and silver couches were arranged on a mosaic floor of red, blue, white, and black marble.

verses.kjv: And they gave them drink in vessels of gold, (the vessels being diverse one from another,) and royal wine in abundance, according to the state of the king.
verses.ct: Drinks were served in golden cups, each one uniquely designed, and the royal wine flowed generously, as you would expect from a king of his stature.

verses.kjv: And the drinking was according to the law; none did compel: for so the king had appointed to all the officers of his house, that they should do according to every man’s pleasure.
verses.ct: The rule for drinking was that no one was pressured — the king had instructed all his palace servants to let each guest drink as much or as little as they wanted.

verses.kjv: Also Vashti the queen made a feast for the women in the royal house which belonged to king Ahasuerus.
verses.ct: At the same time, Queen Vashti hosted her own banquet for the women inside King Ahasuerus's royal palace.

verses.kjv: On the seventh day, when the heart of the king was merry with wine, he commanded Mehuman, Biztha, Harbona, Bigtha, and Abagtha, Zethar, and Carcas, the seven chamberlains that served in the presence of Ahasuerus the king,
verses.ct: On the 7th day, when the king was in high spirits from the wine, he gave orders to Mehuman, Biztha, Harbona, Bigtha, Abagtha, Zethar, and Carcas — the 7 personal attendants who served him directly —

verses.kjv: To bring Vashti the queen before the king with the crown royal, to shew the people and the princes her beauty: for she was fair to look on.
verses.ct: to bring Queen Vashti before him wearing her royal crown, so he could show off her beauty to the people and officials, because she was extremely beautiful.

verses.kjv: But the queen Vashti refused to come at the king’s commandment by his chamberlains: therefore was the king very wroth, and his anger burned in him.
verses.ct: But Queen Vashti refused to come when the king's attendants delivered his command. This made the king furious, and his anger raged inside him.

verses.kjv: Then the king said to the wise men, which knew the times, (for so was the king’s manner toward all that knew law and judgment:
verses.ct: The king then consulted with his wise men who understood legal matters — since it was his custom to seek advice from experts in law and justice.

verses.kjv: And the next unto him was Carshena, Shethar, Admatha, Tarshish, Meres, Marsena, and Memucan, the seven princes of Persia and Media, which saw the king’s face, and which sat the first in the kingdom;)
verses.ct: His closest advisors were Carshena, Shethar, Admatha, Tarshish, Meres, Marsena, and Memucan — the 7 princes of Persia and Media who had direct access to the king and held the highest positions in the kingdom.

verses.kjv: What shall we do unto the queen Vashti according to law, because she hath not performed the commandment of the king Ahasuerus by the chamberlains?
verses.ct: He asked them, "According to the law, what should be done with Queen Vashti, since she has disobeyed the direct command of King Ahasuerus delivered through his attendants?"

verses.kjv: And Memucan answered before the king and the princes, Vashti the queen hath not done wrong to the king only, but also to all the princes, and to all the people that are in all the provinces of the king Ahasuerus.
verses.ct: Memucan spoke up in front of the king and the other officials: "Queen Vashti hasn't just wronged the king alone — she has wronged every official and every person in all the provinces of King Ahasuerus.

verses.kjv: For this deed of the queen shall come abroad unto all women, so that they shall despise their husbands in their eyes, when it shall be reported, The king Ahasuerus commanded Vashti the queen to be brought in before him, but she came not.
verses.ct: Once word of what the queen did spreads to all women everywhere, they will look down on their husbands, saying, 'King Ahasuerus ordered Queen Vashti to come to him, and she refused.'

verses.kjv: Likewise shall the ladies of Persia and Media say this day unto all the king’s princes, which have heard of the deed of the queen. Thus shall there arise too much contempt and wrath.
verses.ct: Before the day is over, the noblewomen of Persia and Media who hear about the queen's behavior will start talking the same way to all the king's officials. There will be no end to the disrespect and conflict.

verses.kjv: If it please the king, let there go a royal commandment from him, and let it be written among the laws of the Persians and the Medes, that it be not altered, That Vashti come no more before king Ahasuerus; and let the king give her royal estate unto another that is better than she.
verses.ct: If it seems right to the king, let a royal decree be issued and recorded in the laws of the Persians and Medes, so it cannot be reversed, stating that Vashti may never again come into the presence of King Ahasuerus. And let the king give her royal position to someone more deserving.

verses.kjv: And when the king’s decree which he shall make shall be published throughout all his empire, (for it is great,) all the wives shall give to their husbands honour, both to great and small.
verses.ct: When this decree is announced throughout the entire empire — and it is a vast empire — every wife will treat her husband with respect, whether he is important or ordinary."

verses.kjv: And the saying pleased the king and the princes; and the king did according to the word of Memucan:
verses.ct: The king and his officials liked this idea, so the king followed Memucan's recommendation.

verses.kjv: For he sent letters into all the king’s provinces, into every province according to the writing thereof, and to every people after their language, that every man should bear rule in his own house, and that it should be published according to the language of every people.
verses.ct: He sent official letters to every province in the kingdom, written in each province's own script and each people's own language, declaring that every man should be the master of his own household. This was proclaimed in the language of every people.
